content: 3 knit across needles 4 through the back loop round 1 knit needle 1 knit across needle 2 until 3 stitches remain k2tog k1 knit across needle 3 needle 4 k 1 ssk knit all other stitches on needle 4 round 2 as round 1 continue decreasing as round 1 until you have a total of 56 stitches on your needles rearrange the stitches put half of the stitches from needle 1 onto needle four 14 stitches on needle 4 this is now needle 4 put the other half of the stitches from needle the old needle 1 onto needle 2 14 stitches and this is now the needle 1 put half of the stitches from needle 3 onto a new needle 2 leave the other half of the stitches from the old needle 3 on the needle and this is the new needle 3 place a beginning of round marker at the start of needle 1 note i do the rearranging by knitting the first half of st on needle 1 onto needle 4 after doing the last decrease i then knit the st on needle 1 with the st on original needle 2 to make a new needle one continue knitting half of the stitches on needle 3 for a new needle 2 and the other half on needle 3 for a new needle 3 then knit needle 4 foot knit the foot to within 2 inches of desired foot length for my husbands size 12 canadian shoe size i knit inches or about 55 rounds wedge toe round 1 knit to last 3 stitches on needle 1 k2tog k1 needle 2 k1 ssk knit to end of needle needle 3 as needle 1 needle 4 as needle 2 round 2 knit all stitches repeat round 1 and 2 four times for a total of 8 rounds round 9 as round 1 repeat round 9 until 24 stitches remain 6 stitches on each needle put stitches from needle 4 and 1 on one needle put stitches from needle 2 and 3 on another needle 12 stitches on each needle kitchener stitch these stitches together weave in all ends soak and block if desired or just wear the socks and block them after the first wash this pattern can be easily adapted to patterns other than stocking stitch pictured is a pair where the leg and top of foot are knit in 3 x 1 rib knit
